meanings.sent1: The puppy was so jivy, always running and playing.
meanings.sent2: The garden looked jivy with all the colorful flowers blooming.
meanings.sent3: The jivy squirrel danced around the tree, entertaining everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a jivy melody, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The jivy festival was a celebration of vitality and happiness.

meanings.definition: To liven up or become lively
meanings.sent1: Music can jivy up any party and make people dance.
meanings.sent2: The fresh coat of paint jivyed the old house, making it look new.
meanings.sent3: Let's jivy up this boring meeting with a fun icebreaker game.
meanings.sent4: Her smile jivyed his spirits, brightening his day.
meanings.sent5: The energetic dance routine jivyed the crowd, getting everyone excited.

meanings.sent1: She's a real jivy, always the life of the party.
meanings.sent2: The jivy at the concert got everyone on their feet, dancing.
meanings.sent3: The little jivy charmed everyone with his cheerful personality.
meanings.sent4: He's a jivy in the office, bringing energy and enthusiasm to the team.
meanings.sent5: The jivy led the group on a hike, keeping everyone motivated and happy.
